title: Proverbs Chapter 11 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Proverbs chapter 11 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Proverbs Chapter 11 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Proverbs Chapter 11.

questions.question: What is described as an abomination to the LORD in Proverbs 11:1?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:1 states that a false balance is an abomination to the LORD, whereas a just weight is his delight.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 11:2, what comes when pride comes?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:2 says that when pride comes, then comes shame; but with the lowly is wisdom.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 11:4 says that riches profit in the day of wrath.
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:4 clearly states that riches profit not in the day of wrath; righteousness delivers from death.

questions.question: Who is delivered out of trouble according to Proverbs 11:8?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:8 states that the righteous is delivered out of trouble, and the wicked comes in his stead.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 11:9, what destroys a neighbour?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:9 says an hypocrite with his mouth destroys his neighbour, but through knowledge the just are delivered.

questions.question: What happens to the city when it goes well with the righteous, according to Proverbs 11:10?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:10 states that when it goes well with the righteous, the city rejoices.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Proverbs 11:14: 'Where no ______ is, the people fall; but in the multitude of counsellors there is safety.'
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:14 teaches that where there is no counsel, the people fall; but with many counselors, there is safety.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 11:16, what does a gracious woman retain?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:16 states that a gracious woman retains honour.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 11:17 says the merciful man doeth good to his own soul.
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:17 affirms that the merciful man doeth good to his own soul.

questions.question: Who is described as being like a jewel of gold in a swine's snout in Proverbs 11:22?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:22 compares a fair woman without discretion to a jewel of gold in a swine's snout.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 11:25, what happens to the liberal soul?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:25 says the liberal soul shall be made fat, meaning it will be enriched or prospered.

questions.question: What will happen to he that trusteth in his riches according to Proverbs 11:28?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:28 states that he who trusts in his riches shall fall, but the righteous shall flourish.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 11:30 says that winning souls is a sign of wisdom.
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:30 teaches that he who wins souls is wise.

questions.question: Who shall be recompensed in the earth according to Proverbs 11:31?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:31 says the righteous shall be recompensed in the earth, and much more the wicked and the sinner.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 11:24, what happens to the one who scattereth?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:24 states that there is one who scattereth and yet increaseth.

medium.title: Proverbs Chapter 11 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Proverbs Chapter 11 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 11:1 teach us about honesty and integrity in business?
options: Using a false balance is detestable to God
Cheating customers is acceptable if unnoticed
Honesty is not important in financial dealings
Only large business owners should be honest
questions.correctAnswer: Using a false balance is detestable to God
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:1 states that a false balance is an abomination to the LORD, but a just weight is His delight, emphasizing that honesty in business dealings pleases God. This aligns with teachings on integrity in Proverbs 11:3 and 11:6.

questions.question: A fellow believer struggles with pride and shame. According to Proverbs 11, what biblical truth would you share about pride?
options: Pride leads to shame, but the humble gain wisdom
Pride is a sign of God's favor
Shame only comes to the weak
questions.correctAnswer: Pride leads to shame, but the humble gain wisdom
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:2 teaches that when pride comes, shame follows, but with the lowly is wisdom. This encourages humility and reliance on God’s wisdom, supported by Proverbs 11:20 which values upright hearts.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 11:3 illustrate the value of integrity in guiding one's life?
options: The integrity of the upright guides them
Integrity is less important than wealth
questions.correctAnswer: The integrity of the upright guides them
questions.explanation: According to Proverbs 11:3, the integrity of the upright leads and guides them, contrasting with the destruction of transgressors. This highlights the importance of living a life of honesty and uprightness as a spiritual discipline.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 11 teaches that riches can save a person in the day of wrath.
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:4 clearly states that riches do not profit in the day of wrath, but righteousness delivers from death, emphasizing trust in God over wealth.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 11, what happens to the wicked by their own actions?
options: They fall by their own wickedness
questions.correctAnswer: They fall by their own wickedness
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:5 teaches that the wicked fall by their own wickedness, underscoring the principle of personal responsibility and consequences for sin.

questions.question: What counsel does Proverbs 11:14 give about making wise decisions in a community?
options: In the multitude of counselors there is safety
Counsel is unnecessary for wise people
Only one leader should make decisions
questions.correctAnswer: In the multitude of counselors there is safety
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:14 teaches that having many advisors helps prevent failure and promotes safety, encouraging believers to seek godly counsel in decision-making.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 11:25 describe the blessing of generosity?
options: The liberal soul shall be made fat
questions.correctAnswer: The liberal soul shall be made fat
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:25 teaches that generosity enriches the giver, blessing those who water others, which aligns with biblical stewardship and sharing.

questions.question: A believer is troubled by conflict at home. According to Proverbs 11, what consequence does Proverbs 11:29 highlight for causing trouble within one’s household?
options: He that troubleth his own house shall inherit the wind
Conflict in the home is always forgiven
Trouble at home leads to blessings
questions.correctAnswer: He that troubleth his own house shall inherit the wind
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:29 warns that causing strife in one’s own household results in futility, encouraging peace and reconciliation in family life.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 11:28 teaches that trusting in riches leads to flourishing.
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:28 states that those who trust in their riches will fall, but the righteous will flourish like a branch, emphasizing faith over wealth.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 11:9 teach about the power of words from a hypocrite?
options: An hypocrite with his mouth destroys his neighbour
Words have no power to harm
questions.correctAnswer: An hypocrite with his mouth destroys his neighbour
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:9 explains how hypocritical speech can harm others, contrasting with the protection knowledge provides the just, highlighting the importance of truthful speech.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: "The fruit of the righteous is a tree of _____; and he that winneth souls is wise."
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:30 states that the fruit of the righteous is a tree of life, illustrating the positive impact of righteous living and soul-winning.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 11:22 compare a woman without discretion?
options: To a jewel of gold in a swine's snout
questions.correctAnswer: To a jewel of gold in a swine's snout
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:22 uses this vivid image to show that beauty without discretion is displeasing and inappropriate, emphasizing wisdom and character in relationships.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 11, what happens when the righteous prosper in a city?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:10 teaches that the prosperity of the righteous brings joy to the city, illustrating the communal blessing of godly living.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 11:13 say about a talebearer versus a man of faithful spirit?
options: A talebearer reveals secrets, a faithful man conceals them
questions.correctAnswer: A talebearer reveals secrets, a faithful man conceals them
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:13 contrasts the destructive nature of gossip with the trustworthiness of a faithful person, urging discretion and faithfulness in relationships.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 11:17 teach about mercy and its effect on the soul?
options: The merciful man does good to his own soul
questions.correctAnswer: The merciful man does good to his own soul
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:17 highlights that showing mercy blesses the giver's soul, encouraging believers to practice compassion as a spiritual discipline.

hard.title: Proverbs Chapter 11 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Proverbs Chapter 11.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 11:1 describe as an abomination to the LORD, reflecting ancient Near Eastern concerns about commerce and justice?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:1 states that a false balance is an abomination to the LORD, highlighting the importance of honesty in trade and weights, a key theme in ancient Near Eastern law codes such as those found in Deuteronomy and Leviticus.

questions.question: In Proverbs 11:3, what guides the upright according to the verse, illustrating a literary parallelism contrasting moral integrity and wickedness?
questions.explanation: The verse states that the integrity of the upright shall guide them, using parallelism to contrast integrity with the perverseness of transgressors, highlighting the moral order emphasized throughout Proverbs.

questions.question: Which verse in Proverbs 11 uses the metaphor of a 'jewel of gold in a swine's snout' to describe a fair woman lacking discretion?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:22 employs this vivid metaphor to illustrate the incongruity of external beauty without wisdom or discretion, reflecting Hebrew poetic imagery emphasizing inner qualities.

questions.question: What outcome does Proverbs 11:28 predict for those who trust in their riches, foreshadowing New Testament warnings against wealth reliance?
questions.explanation: The verse warns that those who trust in riches will fall, a theme echoed in New Testament passages like 1 Timothy 6:17, underscoring the transient nature of wealth versus lasting righteousness.

questions.question: Which verse in Proverbs 11 highlights the value of multiple counselors for safety, reflecting ancient Israelite governance principles?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:14 emphasizes the importance of counsel, paralleling Deuteronomy 1:13 and the wisdom tradition valuing collective decision-making for community stability.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 11:30 describe the 'fruit of the righteous,' linking it to a broader biblical motif of life and wisdom?
questions.explanation: The verse calls the fruit of the righteous a 'tree of life,' connecting to Genesis 2:9 and Revelation 22:2, where the tree symbolizes eternal life and divine blessing.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 11:17, what is the impact of mercy and cruelty on one's own soul and flesh, reflecting ancient Hebrew ethical thought?
options: Mercy benefits the soul; cruelty troubles the flesh
Mercy brings shame; cruelty brings honor
Mercy is weakness; cruelty is strength
Mercy is ignored; cruelty is rewarded
questions.correctAnswer: Mercy benefits the soul; cruelty troubles the flesh
questions.explanation: This verse teaches that doing good (mercy) positively affects oneself, while cruelty causes personal harm, reflecting the Hebrew concept of ethical reciprocity and self-impact.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 11:2 teaches that pride leads to shame, but wisdom is found with the lowly.
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:2 explicitly states that with pride comes shame, and wisdom is with the lowly, highlighting the biblical virtue of humility.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Proverbs 11:24 says, 'There is that scattereth, and yet _______, and there is that withholdeth more than is meet, but it tendeth to poverty.'
questions.explanation: The verse contrasts generosity that leads to increase with stinginess that leads to poverty, emphasizing the biblical principle of blessing through giving.

questions.question: Which verse in Proverbs 11 contrasts the fate of the wicked and the righteous by stating the wicked perish and the righteous prosper, using a chiastic structure?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:23 uses parallelism and chiastic structure to juxtapose the desires and expectations of the righteous and wicked, emphasizing divine justice.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 11:13 warn about a talebearer, highlighting the value of discretion in ancient Hebrew society?
questions.explanation: The verse contrasts the talebearer who reveals secrets with the faithful who conceal them, underscoring the importance of trust and discretion in community life.

questions.question: Which proverb from chapter 11 illustrates the principle that the wicked's own behavior leads to their downfall, a theme also found in Psalms?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:5 states that the wicked shall fall by their own wickedness, echoing Psalms 7:15-16 where the wicked's schemes return upon themselves.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 11:10, what is the communal response when the righteous prosper and the wicked perish?
options: The city rejoiceth and there is shouting
questions.correctAnswer: The city rejoiceth and there is shouting
questions.explanation: The verse highlights communal joy when righteousness flourishes and wickedness ends, emphasizing social harmony resulting from divine justice.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 11:15 describe the risk of becoming surety for a stranger, reflecting ancient Near Eastern economic customs?
questions.explanation: The verse warns that guaranteeing another's debt without knowledge results in loss, reflecting the economic prudence valued in ancient Israel and Near Eastern societies.

questions.question: Proverbs 11:20 states that those with a froward heart are an abomination to the LORD. What literary device is used here to contrast the froward with the upright?
questions.explanation: This verse uses antithetic parallelism, a common Hebrew poetic device, to contrast those who are corrupt with those who are upright and pleasing to God.

theological.title: Proverbs Chapter 11 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Proverbs Chapter 11 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 11:1 identify as an abomination to the LORD?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:1 states that a false balance is an abomination to the LORD because it represents dishonesty and injustice. This aligns with Leviticus 19:36, Deuteronomy 25:13-16, Proverbs 20:23, and Micah 6:8, which emphasize God's demand for just measures and righteousness.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 11:2, what accompanies pride?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:2 teaches that pride leads to shame, contrasting with the wisdom found in humility. This is consistent with Isaiah 2:11, James 4:6, 1 Peter 5:5, and Luke 14:11, which affirm that God opposes the proud but gives grace to the humble.

questions.question: What guides the upright, according to Proverbs 11:3?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:3 emphasizes that the integrity of the upright guides them, reflecting God's principle that righteousness directs life. This is supported by Psalm 25:21, Proverbs 10:9, Psalm 26:1, and 2 Corinthians 8:21, where integrity and righteousness are linked as a guide for the believer.

questions.question: What is said about riches in the day of wrath in Proverbs 11:4?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:4 teaches that riches do not profit in the day of wrath, but righteousness delivers from death. This aligns with James 5:1-3, Matthew 6:19-21, Ecclesiastes 5:10, and 1 Timothy 6:9, emphasizing the futility of wealth apart from righteousness.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'The righteousness of the perfect shall _____ his way; but the wicked shall fall by his own wickedness.' (Proverbs 11:5)
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:5 states that the righteousness of the perfect directs his way, indicating divine guidance for the righteous, while the wicked fall due to their own sins. Psalm 23:3, Proverbs 3:6, Isaiah 26:7, and Psalm 1:6 similarly affirm God's guidance for the righteous.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 11:6, what happens to transgressors?
options: They are taken in their own naughtiness
questions.correctAnswer: They are taken in their own naughtiness
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:6 teaches that the righteousness of the upright delivers them, but transgressors are caught by their own wickedness. This is consistent with Galatians 6:7, Hosea 8:7, Romans 2:6, and Psalm 37:32, which show that sin brings consequences upon the sinner.

questions.question: What happens to the expectation of the wicked when they die, according to Proverbs 11:7?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:7 states the expectation of the wicked perishes at death, highlighting the futility of trusting in wickedness. This aligns with Psalm 37:20, Job 27:8-9, Ecclesiastes 9:10, and Matthew 7:13-14, emphasizing the final judgment upon the wicked.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 11:9, how does a hypocrite affect his neighbor?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:9 warns that a hypocrite destroys his neighbor through his words, whereas the just are delivered through knowledge. This is supported by James 3:6, Ephesians 4:29, Psalm 34:13, and Proverbs 15:4, emphasizing the power of speech for harm or healing.

questions.question: What effect does the blessing of the upright have on a city, according to Proverbs 11:11?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:11 teaches that the blessing of the upright exalts a city, while the wicked's words can overthrow it. This agrees with Psalm 122:6, Jeremiah 29:7, Proverbs 14:34, and 1 Timothy 2:1-2, which show the importance of righteous leadership and prayer for a community's welfare.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 11:14 say about the absence of counsel?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:14 states that without counsel, people fall, but with many counselors, there is safety. This is consistent with Exodus 18:21, Proverbs 15:22, Ecclesiastes 4:9-12, and James 1:5, emphasizing the value of wise advice in governance and personal decisions.

questions.question: Who shall smart for being surety for a stranger, according to Proverbs 11:15?
options: He that is surety for a stranger
questions.correctAnswer: He that is surety for a stranger
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:15 warns that one who becomes surety (guarantor) for a stranger will suffer loss, teaching caution in financial guarantees. This corresponds with Ecclesiastes 5:5, Psalm 37:21, Proverbs 6:1-5, and Luke 14:28, which caution about commitments without foresight.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 11:17, what is the effect of a merciful man on his own soul?
options: He does good to his own soul
questions.correctAnswer: He does good to his own soul
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:17 teaches that mercy benefits the giver's soul, whereas cruelty harms the self. This is consistent with Luke 6:38, Proverbs 19:17, Matthew 25:40, and Galatians 6:7-10, all affirming the blessing and reward of mercy.

questions.question: What reward does he that soweth righteousness receive, according to Proverbs 11:18?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:18 promises a sure reward to those who sow righteousness, contrasting with the deceitful work of the wicked. This aligns with Galatians 6:7-9, 2 Corinthians 9:6, Hebrews 11:6, and Psalm 37:3-6, emphasizing God's faithfulness to reward obedience.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 11:23 say about the desire of the righteous compared to the expectation of the wicked?
options: The desire of the righteous is only good
The desire of the righteous is wrath
The expectation of the wicked is peace
The expectation of the wicked is joy
questions.correctAnswer: The desire of the righteous is only good
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:23 contrasts the righteous, whose desires are good, with the wicked, whose expectations lead to wrath. This is supported by Psalm 34:15, Jeremiah 29:11, Romans 12:2, and Matthew 5:6, teaching that godly desires lead to blessing while wickedness leads to judgment.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 11:28, what happens to those who trust in their riches?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:28 warns that trusting in riches leads to downfall, while the righteous flourish like a branch. This teaching is consistent with Jeremiah 9:23-24, Matthew 6:19-21, 1 Timothy 6:17, and Luke 12:15, which caution against reliance on wealth over God.
